utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: Alright, stand here.

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: You're just tall enough.

utterance.speaker: ALICE
utterance.content: Uh, I don't- I don't think I am.

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: It just goes around. There's nothing to be scared of.

utterance.speaker: ALICE
utterance.content: I didn't say I was scared.

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: You'll be fine. C'mon, when I was a kid, this was my favourite thing ever!

utterance.speaker: ALICE
utterance.content: I don't like rides!

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: Alright, alright, I just thought- I thought it'd be fun. I-I shouldn't be making you do this. Uhh, let's-let's go home, we can have fun at home.

utterance.speaker: ALICE
utterance.content: No, daddy, wait.

utterance.speaker: ALICE
utterance.content: The ride does look like fun.

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: Whoa! This is awesome!

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: Alice? Are you alright?

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: Honey, you alright? Alice! Alice, are you okay?!

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: Nothing happened.

utterance.speaker: EDIE
utterance.content: Something happened.

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: It was a little kiddie-ride.

utterance.speaker: EDIE
utterance.content: She hates those rides. I don't understand why you insist on making her...

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Okay! I appreciate the fullness of your answers, but I just wanted to know if she'd had any history of abdominal problems.

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: EDIE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: The admitting doctor noted no family history of...

utterance.speaker: EDIE
utterance.content: I have an aunt with Crohn's disease. You didn't mention that?

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: I-I forgot what it was called. Your aunt, she's got million things wrong with her.

utterance.speaker: EDIE
utterance.content: If you paid attention for five minutes...

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: I doubt it's Crohn's. She has none of the other symptoms...

utterance.speaker: EDIE
utterance.content: You're alone with her for eight hours, she ends up in the hospital.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: I'm wondering if we can focus on answering the questions, Mrs. Hartman?

utterance.speaker: EDIE
utterance.content: I'm not Mrs. Hartman. We're divorced.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: I suspected.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: ...And your past generosity made me think of you.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: We're half a million dollars from our goal. Of course, this is a naming opportunity for your foundation.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Is-is there a problem?

utterance.speaker: FEMALE DONOR
utterance.content: There's something on your, uh, face.

utterance.speaker: FEMALE DONOR
utterance.content: It-It's, uh... ahem.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Oh, God.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: I'm sitting in there, hoping it's a sniper, because at least then the sociopath isn't my employee.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: This baby won me second place in the clinic's weekly "Weirdest Thing Pulled Out An Orifice" contest.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: I am this close to putting a new lab in Oncology.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You do not wanna know what came in first.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: House...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Rhymes with "fucchini".

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Gimme his pills.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Where's my prescription?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: No more free-flowing prescriptions. Princeton PD has already forced Wilson to shut down.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: A cop says "Boo", Wilson shuts down.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Every doctor in this place is afraid to make a move, without covering his ass.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You think maybe you're shouting at the wrong person? Tritter's obviously out to get me. He doesn't care...

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: You forged prescriptions!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Allegedly.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Your pain has become my pain. From now on, you get reasonable doses at reasonable times.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: But I hurt in an unreasonable way.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Then dip into your secret stash.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Tritter took it.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Then move on to your secret-secret stash.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I ran out.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Then move on to your secret-secret-secret stash!

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Parents say she's not on any meds.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: If the pancreatitis wasn't set off by drugs and she hasn't been sick, that leaves trauma. Or some kind of structural defect. Put up the CT.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: What's that density there?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Shadow looks normal to me.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: We got a referral from...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: 'Scuse me!

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: You stash your drugs in a Lupus textbook.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It's never Lupus. Who's got gallstones, so why do we care?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Gallstones?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: The Biliary duct is dilated. Probably from a stone lodged in it. Musta caused a nasty case of pancreatitis.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: She's six. Six-year-olds don't get gallstones.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: So... she didn't have pancreatitis?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Your theory is an invisible gallstone?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: His theory correctly predicted the pancreatitis.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: You might wanna wait until he actually tells us his theory, before you start kissing his theory's ass.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: My theory is... vanishing gallstone.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: She had it and it passed. Those things travel in packs. Most of them probably hiding out in her gallbladder. Do an ultrasound. If I'm right, take out the organ, so we can analyse the stones.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: I wasn't kissing his arse.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: It just looked that way from our angle. You on your knees, House bending over.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: He predicted the pancreatitis.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: It's his dad's fault.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: My dad was an arse.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: But you did everything he wanted you to and, in return, you got everything you wanted.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Shyeah! It's that simple.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: His strategy worked. Dad got him a cushy job, paid for his cushy life.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Cut me out of his cushy will.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: I told you, just his nature. Poor guy's hardwired to kiss ass.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: House was right. Gallstones.

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: I didn't know a kid could get gallstones?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: It's... unusual. That's why we need to see what's causing it. We'd like to remove Alice's gallbladder and analyse the stones.

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: EDIE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: Just 'cause I said "sure"?

utterance.speaker: EDIE
utterance.content: I am capable of my own thought...

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: It's a simple procedure. The gallbladder isn't essential...

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: The doctor thinks we should do it, we should do it.

utterance.speaker: EDIE
utterance.content: You think maybe we should get a second opinion, before we start removing our child's organs.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: 'S an effective use of tax-payers' money.

utterance.speaker: TRITTER
utterance.content: I'm actually off this week.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: I'm guessing you don't have a family.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Most people have enough going on in their lives that they don't have to personalize every slight.

utterance.speaker: TRITTER
utterance.content: This isn't personal. Not anymore.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: My Head of Oncology had to shut down. My entire staff are afraid to make a move without covering their ass.

utterance.speaker: TRITTER
utterance.content: I think you're angry at the wrong person.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: You think Dr. Wilson deserved to have his assets seized? His entire practice ruined?

utterance.speaker: TRITTER
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: So, you just... don't care?

utterance.speaker: TRITTER
utterance.content: This is how I get what I want. I put pressure... on people. And if it doesn't work on Wilson, it'll work on you.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: You punish the innocent.

utterance.speaker: TRITTER
utterance.content: None of you are innocent.

utterance.speaker: TRITTER
utterance.content: Not one of you.

utterance.speaker: TRITTER
utterance.content: Not one of you has told me the truth about Dr. House.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: The pills allow him to cope with the pain.

utterance.speaker: TRITTER
utterance.content: No, the pills... distort... reality. He is an addict.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: He's not out robbing a liquor store.Or...

utterance.speaker: TRITTER
utterance.content: Look, he's treating people. He needs to find a different way to cope, before he kills somebody! If he hasn't done that already.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: _If_ you're right, he has a medical problem. It should be dealt with by doctors! Not by the...!

utterance.speaker: TRITTER
utterance.content: Well, it's not being dealt with by doctors. Doctors are covering it... up.

utterance.speaker: TRITTER
utterance.content: The whole point of the criminal justice system... is to make things right, when everything else fails. With all due respect, you have failed.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Sorry, didn't know you wanted your kid dead. Although for a couple of G's, I can still make it happen.

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: Who the hell are you?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I am a complete stranger, who apparently cares more about whether your kid dies than you do.

utterance.speaker: EDIE
utterance.content: You're Dr. House.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You've seen my stage show.

utterance.speaker: EDIE
utterance.content: She's not dying. She has pancreatitis. Once you've treated that, I'm taking her home.

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: And do what? Burn sage? I want you to do the surgery.

utterance.speaker: EDIE
utterance.content: My father had gallstones. They were totally harmless. Alice had one bad one, but it passed. For all we know, this is over.

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: And for all we know, she could get sick again tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: EDIE
utterance.content: Then I'll take her to our paediatrician. She's six, Rob. She shouldn't have unnecessary surgery.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Or a moron for a mom. What can you do?

utterance.speaker: EDIE
utterance.content: You're the doctor. I'm the mother. I outrank you. Live with it.

utterance.speaker: JUDGE
utterance.content: I've read the file. You've got fifteen minutes.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: 'S people like this who killed Copernicus.

utterance.speaker: JUDGE
utterance.content: Galileo.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Either way.

utterance.speaker: JUDGE
utterance.content: And they just locked Galileo up.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: They killed his spirit. And nobody likes a showoff.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Luckily, Alice Hartman has a dad, who's willing to see reason.

utterance.speaker: JUDGE
utterance.content: Reason is defined by slavishly deferring to you.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Their doctor.

utterance.speaker: EDIE
utterance.content: Your Honour, I've had no opportunity to consult my attorney.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: There's no time.

utterance.speaker: EDIE
utterance.content: All I want is a second opinion before...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No time!

utterance.speaker: JUDGE
utterance.content: Your testimony is their child will die if I don't grant this motion right now.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Am I under oath?

utterance.speaker: JUDGE
utterance.content: Let's say yes.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: My testimony is that this child might die if you don't grant this motion right now.

utterance.speaker: JUDGE
utterance.content: Literally no time for a second opinion.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Won't be as good as the first opinion.

utterance.speaker: JUDGE
utterance.content: Dr. Cuddy, what do you think?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: She's not a specialist in this area. Her opinion is worthless.

utterance.speaker: JUDGE
utterance.content: Dr. Cuddy, what do you think of Dr. House? Is he as big a jerk as I think he is?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Bigger. But he knows what he's talking about.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Got a page.

utterance.speaker: EDIE
utterance.content: She's complaining about her stitches.

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: Nurse just said that's completely normal. Did you, uh, get the test results for the gallstones?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Any minute now.

utterance.speaker: EDIE
utterance.content: There's no time for a second opinion, but the test takes three...

utterance.speaker: ALICE
utterance.content: My skin hurts.

utterance.speaker: EDIE
utterance.content: I know I no longer have the right to demand it, but could you please take a look?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: She's pissed, now she's looking for things to go wrong.

utterance.speaker: EDIE
utterance.content: You're right. I'm sooo petty, I hope she dies so it vindicates my opinion.

utterance.speaker: EDIE
utterance.content: I didn't mean that, sweetie. Mommy was being sarcastic.

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: She's a few years away from grasping the sarcasm, don't you think?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Guys!

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: I already gave you that number.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Simple surgical procedure turns a little girl into the English patient. What gives?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Must be allergic to something we used in the surgery.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Cameron. C-A-M-E-R-O-N.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: This is my office, I'm talking, there are people here who work for me, but not listening. Explain this to me.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Tritter froze my account. They're checking theirs. I'm on hold with the lawyer.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Call Wilson's lawyer. He'll tell you exactly how and why you're screwed. This kid has no history of allergies.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: You gotta talk to Tritter! You gotta make this go away!

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Yeah, great plan! The man's obviously open to reason.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Here's the plan - we do nothing. We while away the time, diagnosing the patient. Stones were calcium, bilirubin and pigment stones.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Which are non-conclusive.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Kid presented with low-grade fever, mild anaemia. That plus the stones indicates bacterial infection.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Bacterial infections don't cause a vesicular rash. And doing nothing is not a plan, it's specifically a lack of a plan!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: We cut into her belly, bad boys escape. They swarm over, colonize the wounds and- Kaplow!- vesicular rash.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Allergic reaction is a hundred times more likely with or without a history. Fever and anaemia could've been symptoms of pancreatitis. Hello?... Thank you for your help.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: They froze my accounts.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: "Thank you for your help"?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: It's not her fault.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: He hasn't gotten to mine yet. I'm gonna withdraw as much as I can, as fast as I can. Lunch is on me.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Do a scratch test, check for allergies. When it comes back negative, start broad-spectrum antibiotics.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Bullies bully. They don't get a reaction, they lose interest. Now go do what I ask, before I stick your heads into toilets.

utterance.speaker: EDIE
utterance.content: How'd Otto get here?

utterance.speaker: ALICE
utterance.content: Daddy got him last night.

utterance.speaker: EDIE
utterance.content: He was at the dry-cleaner, they close at six. How'd you get it?

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: I drove over there and knocked for about ten minutes. Then I begged...

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: How 'bout some ice-cream for when this is through?

utterance.speaker: ALICE
utterance.content: My tummy hurts.

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: Ginger-ale?

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: EDIE
utterance.content: I'll take care of her.

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: Be right back.

utterance.speaker: EDIE
utterance.content: He's always been good with the big, romantic gestures, but ask him to do the dishes or show up for a meal on time or drive her.....

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Almost done here.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: What're you doing here?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: I work here.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You passively-aggressively gave up your practice.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: I've clinic hours.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Now you're passively-aggressively spreading peanut butter. Big sign around your neck saying "Wilson does not have enough cash for the cafeteria".

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: You know, before Lenny Bruce died of the drug overdose...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Oyyyyeeesh. You're gonna confront me with everyone who's ever used narcotics. Damn, I have to get something to read.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: He was arrested on obscenity charges. Went through a series of arrests and trials, because he just couldn't stop challenging the police.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: He became obsessed with his own legal problems and his act turned into long humourless rants about fascist cops and the violation of his rights.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I get it, I get it, I need to change my nightclub act. Need more props.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: House, scratch test is getting results. A lot of results.

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: How could she be allergic to everything?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: She can't be. Has to be an infection.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: You see positive allergy tests and decide it's an infection?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Bacteria got into the scratches in her back.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Infections radiate. The shape of this isn't...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Eat this.

utterance.speaker: ALICE
utterance.content: I don't feel like eating.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Make you better.

utterance.speaker: EDIE
utterance.content: A sandwich?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Magic sandwich.

utterance.speaker: ALICE
utterance.content: There's no such thing as...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Just take a damn bite, okay, kid?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Amazing how she didn't go into anaphylactic shock.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: It's diagnostically ridiculous.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Right! She's allergic to everything except peanuts.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: If she is allergic, antibiotics could cause massive systemic reaction.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: If she's allergic. But she's not.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Chase, you're right. The shape indicates allergy, the tests indicate allergy. Just because she's not allergic to peanuts, doesn't mean she's not allergic to Lidocaine or...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Chase! Hang the bag! And grow a backbone tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: No, I'm not giving my daughter drugs that can shut her system down.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You know what else shuts down systems? Death!

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: Sorry! I can't let you do this.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Luckily, Alice Hartman has a mom who is willing to see reason.

utterance.speaker: JUDGE
utterance.content: You were in here yesterday, telling me her father's guardianship was best for her.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I honestly figured I'd get a different judge today.

utterance.speaker: JUDGE
utterance.content: You agree with Dr. House now?

utterance.speaker: EDIE
utterance.content: Now, my kid actually is sick.

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: She was sick yesterday.

utterance.speaker: EDIE
utterance.content: Her paediatrician doesn't know what's wrong with her, says Dr. House is the best...

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: She loses guardianship and all of a sudden, House is a hero! It's got nothing to do with me deciding...

utterance.speaker: JUDGE
utterance.content: Hey, zip it! I've heard enough.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: This lawyering thing is easy.

utterance.speaker: JUDGE
utterance.content: You shut up too! Arguing over decision is a waste of her time. And mine. Since her parents can't or won't agree, I'm awarding temporary guardianship to a doctor. Who will place the health of the child above all else.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: I don't think Dr. House is capable of...

utterance.speaker: JUDGE
utterance.content: Dr. Cuddy.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Yes, your Honour?

utterance.speaker: JUDGE
utterance.content: No, I was finishing my sentence. The kid's all yours.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Three o'clock! Gimme the pills!

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: I don't even know this kid. How am I supposed to decide what's best for her?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Fine! I'll choose. Always side with the angry doctor's opinion. Gimme my pills.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: We're not gonna go broad-spectrum. There's any chance that she's allergic...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: There is no chance...

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Of course there's a chance.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I'm appealing.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: No, you're not. Think of bacterial, pick one antibiotic.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Not gonna be enough. Need to go broad-spectrum...

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: It kills bugs, that's what you want. And go with metronidazole.

utterance.speaker: TRITTER
utterance.content: You don't have to testify he's broken any laws. Though I'm sure you could. Just how many pills he takes in a day. 'Cause I'm fairly confident I can prove that he didn't... have that many... legitimate prescriptions.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: You really hope noone dies while I'm sitting here and not talking to you?

utterance.speaker: TRITTER
utterance.content: I, uh, I had a, uh, had a buddy at Trenton PD... do some digging. Your brother locked up for drugs. Your own flesh and blood. Now you don't even visit. But your boss practises medicine on drugs. Time to start lying to the cops.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: If I went out for coffee, will I get back before you make your point?

utterance.speaker: TRITTER
utterance.content: You, uhm, you testify. I can make sure that Marcus goes free on parole in less than two months.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: My brother and I, we grew up in the same home. But I made something of myself. He didn't.

utterance.speaker: TRITTER
utterance.content: Dr. Foreman, the way you talk, you think you never committed any crimes yourself. Now, you and Dr. House, you are both cold bastards. You don't give a damn about your brother, and you can't stand House. But I do expect you to take this deal, because you hate hypocrisy more. House has had a thousand chances. You had two chances. Why is your brother stuck at one?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Well, if she were allergic to this antibiotic, we would have seen it by now. I think we are out of the woods as far as that goes.

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: Guess I occasionally get one right.

utterance.speaker: EDIE
utterance.content: You're gonna be glib about this? You almost killed her.

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: I made a choice. The same choice that you made yesterday. Only when I make it, I'm an imbecile.

utterance.speaker: EDIE
utterance.content: Every decision you have made has been wrong. When this is over, I'm suing for sole custody.

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: Because I trusted doctors when you didn't?!

utterance.speaker: EDIE
utterance.content: Because... it's not just about the past two days!

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: Like you have the hotline on what's best for Alice! She loves me.

utterance.speaker: EDIE
utterance.content: She never does her homework when she's with you, she never brushes her hair...

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Her heart's racing, pressure's rising! The two of you, get out.

utterance.speaker: EDIE
utterance.content: What- I'm her mother. You can't just-

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: You fight, she has an anxiety attack. The two of you are making her worse. Get-out and don't come back.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: How's the kid doing?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Much better as of about two hours ago. Got any money for lunch?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: If you like parsley and croutons. Tritter finally froze my accounts.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: You surprised? Why wouldn't he?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: I figured if he was singling you out, you must have done something different.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: What? Like talking?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Yeah. And now that he's frozen your accounts, you probably will. You need the cash, right?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: He doesn't freeze my accounts, I'm guilty. He does freeze my accounts, I'm guilty.

utterance.speaker: EDIE
utterance.content: Is Alice having some procedure done?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: She's fine. She's resting.

utterance.speaker: EDIE
utterance.content: Where?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: In her room. But you're not supposed to...

utterance.speaker: EDIE
utterance.content: I was just at the window. There's no one in there. Her backpack wasn't there either.

utterance.speaker: EDIE
utterance.content: You don't think her father could've...?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Call security!

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Get a gurney!

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: She's stiff! She can't move! I don't know what happened. I mean, she seemed fine.

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: Help her, please!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: On the plus side, she could medal at luge.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Muscle rigidity is almost exclusively neurological.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Neuroaxonal dystrophy. She's the right age.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Except that her liver's starting to shut down. No dystrophy.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Metronidazole - great idea.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Let's not go broad-spectrum. Let's not take any chances at actually curing her.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: House, can you focus on the case?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No! 'Cause I'm in pain! 'Cause you think that compromise's the answer to everything! I need more pills!

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Muscle rigidity plus liver involvement means Wilson's.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: No, no corneal rings, no mental changes.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Then what?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I need more pills!!

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: No! You are on a reasonable...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: What the hell does "reasonable" mean?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Keep it quiet. Her BP reacts to stress. And yelling is not go...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You think that I'm not in pain. Then don't give me anything. Keep me away from the aspirin. If I'm in a buttload of pain, I need a buttload of pills!

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Fine! You need more pills. You're not getting them. You can have all the aspirin you want...

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: I say we draw straws. Loser drives out to Trenton, scores him an eight-ball.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Which one of you two gave her an aspirin?

utterance.speaker: EDIE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Her symptoms fit Reye's Syndrome. Which doesn't make any sense, unless you took aspirin.

utterance.speaker: EDIE
utterance.content: Rob?

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: No way. She's a kid. I've read the eight hundred warning labels.

utterance.speaker: EDIE
utterance.content: I'm not even angry. I just want her to be okay.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: She's lying. She's angry. 'Cause you kidnapped her kid. She'll be angrier if the kid dies.

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: I didn't.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: One aspirin! Combined with the preexisting infections is all it takes to set off an atta...

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: I'm not lying.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Well, sure. You certainly earned her trust. Where was Alice the night she came in?

utterance.speaker: EDIE
utterance.content: W-With me. Well, at my house. I went out, she stayed with the baby-sitter.

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: Where were you?

utterance.speaker: EDIE
utterance.content: None of your business.

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: You hired someone that might have poisoned our daughter.

utterance.speaker: EDIE
utterance.content: She's fifteen. She's very responsible.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: She a fifteen-year-old pharmacist? Or is it just some kid from down the street, who needed twenty bucks for lip gloss and couple of Tiger Beats?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Put your kid on charcoal hemoperfusion.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Shouldn't we hear what the baby-sitter has to say?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I know what she's gonna say. She's gonna lie to save her business. Gimme more pills.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: We are going to use this machine to clean your blood. It goes out of you and through a filter. You know, like a filter in a fish-tank.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: It's... kinda cool actually.

utterance.speaker: ALICE
utterance.content: I'm scared.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: It... won't hurt. It takes a while, so it'll be boring, but won't hurt. It's gonna make you better.

utterance.speaker: ALICE
utterance.content: They hate each other, don't they? Never gonna be together again.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Well, you never know.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Gonna break out the rubber hoses, the bright lights? I'm not gonna testify, just because I have to borrow lunch money.

utterance.speaker: TRITTER
utterance.content: I know. Women don't give up guys that... they're in love with.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: I'm not in love with House.

utterance.speaker: TRITTER
utterance.content: The guy is unhinged and unethical, does what he wants with no concern for others. But you stand by him.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: That can't just be loyalty and respect?

utterance.speaker: TRITTER
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: I'm a girl. So I must be in love with him.

utterance.speaker: TRITTER
utterance.content: Not because you're a girl. Because ten years ago, you got an A in Calculus, until you ratted yourself out. Showed your professor a mistake he missed. Because you married a man...

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Don't go there!

utterance.speaker: TRITTER
utterance.content: You used to be someone, who did the right thing. House has changed you. D'you think it's all been for the better?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: How's it going?

utterance.speaker: ALICE
utterance.content: Bo-o-ring.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Told ya.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: So far, so good. Just like five minutes ago, ten minutes before that.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: What's the matter?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: It's from a clot.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Let's get her out of here. I'll call the OR.

utterance.speaker: ALICE
utterance.content: You said it wouldn't hurt.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Found it.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: She's burning up.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: In a sec.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Foreman, she is on fire!

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Almost there.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Get me some cooling blankets, now.

utterance.speaker: NURSE
utterance.content: Right away.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Everytime we touch this kid, something goes wrong.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Bad mojo is not a diagnosis.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: You really have to flash your private stash in front of me?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You find it easier to lie for me if it's more subtle? Fine!

utterance.speaker: TRITTER
utterance.content: You told your associates that, uh, I'd frozen your accounts.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: TRITTER
utterance.content: Smart lie. You figured they'd think there was a reason that you'd been singled out. Like that, uh, you'd agreed to testify against House.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Yeah, I assume that's why you did it.

utterance.speaker: TRITTER
utterance.content: You have a, uh, reputation as a bit of an opportunist. You already gave your boss up once, from what I've heard.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: To save my job. He goes down now, I lose my job.

utterance.speaker: TRITTER
utterance.content: If you lose your job, you find another one. You get fired, chances don't look so hot.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Why would he fire me?

utterance.speaker: TRITTER
utterance.content: Because you rolled on him.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: I haven't rolled on him.

utterance.speaker: TRITTER
utterance.content: I think you will. And he's gonna think you already did.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: As far as he knows, my accounts are frozen, just like everyone else's.

utterance.speaker: TRITTER
utterance.content: In twenty-four hours, all three of you will have access to your accounts again.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Why would you do...?

utterance.speaker: TRITTER
utterance.content: If I was looking at this, as an outsider , I would say it was because Detective Tritter had what appeared to be a very pleasant lunch with Dr, Chase.

utterance.speaker: TRITTER
utterance.content: The two of them appear to be... working together.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: How the hell are there no ice-packs in the OR?!

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: That's out. Ice packs aren't going to hold it for long. Where are the blankets?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: In the ER. They've joined the four car collision.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: We need to cool this kid down before her brain melts.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: What're you doing?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: She got a major dose of heparin to thin her blood for the procedure. Could have induced thrombocytopenia.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: That's... unlikely. The charcoal would have absorbed a lot of the heparin. She’s been anaemic. Could be a primary blood disorder.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: or we never cured the infection.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Are you saying she never had Reye's? We just put that girl through excruciating pain.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Pain wasn't House's fault. Even if the clot was a reaction to what we gave her, we still have to...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I don't need you to cover my ass! What I need is my Vicodin! Two pills every six hours. Like I'm on an allowance. She's given the cop leverage over medical decisions! What the hell, why don't we get a plumber in here, ask his opinion! Hey Cuddy, you know any rodeo clowns who can weigh in...!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Where the hell is she?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Look at her arm.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Told you it was an infection.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: We fixed the infection!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Well, apparently not! I asked you for broad-spectrum, you put her on the bare minimum! It's a good thing you failed to become a mom, 'cause you suck at it!!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: What's good about this rash?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Good guesses! But no.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It's on parts of her body that we haven't touched. She's got a fever of a hundred-and-three. She's in and out of consciousness. But it's not a reaction to anything we did. Our mojo is off the table. Which means...?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Oh! So close. Means thanks to Cuddy's candy-ass approach, broad-spectrum antibiotics are no longer an option. This thing has grown horns and fangs. We gotta figure out what species it is. Go in with a spear to the heart.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Okay, you guys are sulking. I don't really care why, but apparently I can't do my job without finding out.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Tritter released our bank accounts.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Horrible, horrible news. Wow! I'm glad we didn't let that fester. If she did have Reye's, then it could be varicella or associated...

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: He released our money. You do know what that means?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: The correct question is "How can it be varicella given that she's not itchy?".

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Rickettsialpox causes rash, fever and muscle pain.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Pain, not paralysis. Rocky Mountain Spotted Fever, on the other hand, rash, fever, anaemia, paralysis and I didn't say anything to Tritter.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Neither did I.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Maybe he wants us to think that one of us talked.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: It worked.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: You were with him.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: We were all with him.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: _We_ weren't laughing with him.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Maybe he just gave up. Start the kid on chloramphenicol for Rocky Mountain Spotted Fever.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Can we talk?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Nope.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: I really think you need...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Either you screwed me and you want absolution, or you didn't and you want applause. Either way, not interested.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: I'm busy.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: You okay?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Yeah, sure.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Uhm, what I meant by "Are you okay" is "What the hell did House do"?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Nothing.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: What did he say?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: I've seen House be rude a thousand times, usually to achieve something. I have never seen him be mean just because he can.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Seriously? What did he say?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Nothing. Doesn't matter.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Well, I've seen House be rude to you a thousand times, but I've never seen it get it you.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: People think House has no... inner censor. The fact is he holds himself back, because when he wants to hurt, he knows just where to poke a sharp stick. I have been trying to get pregnant. And House knew. He told me I'm a failure as a mother.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: And you're this upset because... you think he's right?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: I have had three separate implantations - the first two never took, the last one, I... lost.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: I'm sorry. You didn't fail. Those were physical events.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: A little girl is... scared and in pain. I was... awkward. Terrified of doing the wrong thing.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: That's normal. That's...

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: I didn't hug her. I didn't even... reach out and hold her hand. I told her it was gonna be okay.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: She needed reassurance.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: I told her her folks might get back together. When I see people with their kids, it's so natural. It's like they have an instruction book imprinted on their genes. Maybe I just didn't get a copy. Maybe my wanting to be a mother is like a... tone-deaf person wanting sing opera or a paraplegic who wants

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa! Well, I see what you mean about House poking the right spot.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Chloramphenicol isn't working.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: What dose did you give her?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Yeah, maybe Chase screwed up.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: You always end up there, just getting a jump on it.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: I doubled her up.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Okay, the infection's morphed. It's moved into her muscle sheath.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Necrotizing fasciitis?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: That's impervious to drugs.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: The only treatment is to cut away the infected area. So we amputate.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Arm and leg? We can't cut a six-year-old kid in half without a confirmed diagnosis.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It moves too quickly and we waited too long. We don't have time for a culture.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: We can at least observe her for few hours, confirm the rash is spreading.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It spreads, she dies.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: You're talking about crippling her.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: We're not even certain this was an infection.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Right!! She's six! She's cute! She can't have flesh-eating bacteria! It's just wrong! Let's cure her with sunshine and puppies! Cute kids die of terrible illnesses! Innocent doctors go to jail, just because cowards like you won't stand up and do what's required! You can sit around and moan about who's the

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I'm gonna go do my job.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: What kind of quality of life will she have without...?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: One thing about life - it's got qualities.

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: And if we can't agree?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: I don't know.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: He's yelled at us before.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: 'Cause he thought our theories were dumb, not because our theories were sending him to jail.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: He's going through withdrawal. Could be causing mild paranoia. It'll pass, we just have to suffer through it.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: We never ruled out allergy.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: We gave her drugs. She had no negative reaction.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: We cut open her belly, she got a rash on her belly. We did a scratch test on her back, she had a rash on her back. I know House ruled out mojo, but it can't be a coincidence...

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Little late to be playing differential games, isn't it?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Get that thing away from me! I don't wanna get burned.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Laser pointers don't burn you, genius.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Skin, no. Retina, yes.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: You don't trust my aim? Maybe you should cover any sensitive...

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: He was wrong about the puppies!

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: House!

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Gotta stop the surgery! She doesn't have necrotizing fasciitis!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Oh good.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: She's got erythropoietic protoporphyria! She's allergic to light. It's genetic. Either parent could have carried it.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I know what it is. Infection fits better.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: She gets worse everytime she goes under surgical lights! Dad takes her outside...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Liver's shot too. She swallow a flashlight?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Stop the surgery!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Get the hell out of my way.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: No! I'm...

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Light damages the blood cells. The damaged blood cells contain protoporphyrin. The protoporphyrin builds up in the liver. That's why the liver's shutting down!

utterance.speaker: NURSE
utterance.content: Stop!

utterance.speaker: EDIE
utterance.content: How can she be allergic to light? She's never had this problem before.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Negative reaction starts at birth. It reaches critical mass right around this age.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Her blood cells create chemicals in reaction to the light.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: When they reach the liver, it tries to filter out the bad cells. The chemicals damage the liver. And one by-product is gallstones.

utterance.speaker: EDIE
utterance.content: So she'll just keep getting worse?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: EP can be managed. We'll give her beta-carotine. She's gonna need special lightbulbs and filters on the windows. She's probably gonna need to be home-schooled. Her life will be complicated... but she will live.

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: How do you get something like this?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: It's genetic.

utterance.speaker: EDIE
utterance.content: So, one of us...?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Both of you must be carriers.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: She's gonna wanna see you when she wakes up. So... don't screw it up.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: So, what's new?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: House missed one.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: It's happened before.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: He nearly maimed a little girl. I got it right. And I told him, and it didn't matter.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Chase, you solved one. You helped a patient. That better be enough for you. Beckett was going to call his play "Waiting for House’s Approval", but thought it was too grim.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Trust me, I'm not waiting any more.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: I'm gonna need thirty pieces of silver.
